Record.Value: Gas Mixing
Practical Training: Stage IV
Flex your skills in the realm of gas filtration and mixing to create atmospheres, fuels and more.
Welcome Cadet. Stationeer Command wants to test your knowledge of gas filtering and mixing, to ensure you can provide fuels and liveable atmospheres when building ODA bases.

Your welder is out of gas, and you need to create more fuel. First, you need a source of oxygen. Luckily, plants create oxygen from CO2, which you have in your suit's waste tank. So vent your suit's waste tank in the hydroponics room.
Open suit waste tank
Close suit waste tank
To collect the oxygen, build an active vent in the highlighted position. We'll use this to pump oxygen from the rom.
Get active vent from crate
Build active vent in highlighted position
Now, move through the airlock to the atmospherics room to build your gas mixing system.
Go to gas room
You can use a filtration unit to separate out oxygen from the hydroponic room atmosphere. Build a filtration unit in the highlighted position.
Get atmospherics kit from crate
Build filtration unit in highlighted position
Complete the green oxygen pipe network. This will connect the hydroponic room's atmospheric pipe network to the filtration unit's input.
Get pipes from crate
Complete oxygen pipe network
The filtration unit also creates waste gas. So connect the unit to the waste gas network, which expells outside.
Get the other Pipe kit from the crate
Connect the waste network with pipes from the crate
A filtration unit can filter out two gases simultaneously, but right now you need oxygen - so add an oxygen filter in the unit.
Get oxygen filter from crate
Insert oxygen filter in filtration unit
In order to reduce the chance of your fuel accidentally igniting, it's a good idea to cool your gas. Passing your pipes outside, and adding radiators is a good way to do this.
Get pipe radiator from crate
Add pipe radiator in highlighted position
The ice crusher is also a good way to obtain certain gases. Connect the ice crusher's gas output to the 'volatile' gas network.
Get Ice Crusher from crate
Build Ice Crusher in highlighted position
Use Iron Sheets on the Ice Crusher
Complete the Ice crusher with cables

The other component of fuel is volatile gas. Get the mining belt from the crate, then add the volatiles to the ice crusher. Note that volatiles sublime rapidly, but not inside the ice crusher (or ore belt).
Get mining belt from crate
Add stack of volatiles to ice crusher
Now build a gas mixer in the highlighted position - this will allow you to connect your two pipe networks and blend your fuel mix at the correct ratio.
Get the gas mixer from crate
Build gas mixer at highlighted position
You need to make sure that you're not overpressuring your canister. Adding a pressure regulator will ensure you fill your canister safely.
Get pressure regulator from crate
Build pressure regulator in highlighted position.
Valves allow us to control the flow of gases or liquids inside pipes. Because losing control is dangerous.
Get the pipe valve from the crate
Place valve in highlighted position
You need a tank storage unit, so you can recharge your cannister. Tank storage units attach directly to pipe networks.
Get tank storage unit from crate
Build tank storage unit in highlighted position
Excellent! Your gas network is now set up. Insert the empty tank from your welder into the storage unit, so it's ready to be charged up.
Get canister from crate
Insert welder fuel canister into tank
To determine correct fuel ratio for your tank, consult the Stationpedia Canister (Fuel) page.
Set gas mixer valve to 66:34
Consult Canister (Fuel) page in Stationpedia
Close Stationpedia
Now set the pressure on the regulator. A safe pressure for canisters is 1950kPa, although they can tolerate up to almost 10MPa.
Set pressure on regulator to 1950kPa
Great work Cadet! Now that everything's set up we can safely begin turnnig on our equitment and start producing fuel.
Turn on active vent in hydroponics room
Turn on ice crusher
Turn on filtration unit
Turn on gas mixer
Turn on pressure regulator
The volatiles and oxygen are currently waiting in the pipe. Open the valves to let the gas flow into the gas mixer.
Open volatiles pipe valve
Open oxygen pipe valve
Your fuel canister is now refilled! Insert it into your welder.
Return fuel canister to welder
Done! Good job! Press the button!
